name: NCAD Gallary
directions: Enter via Thomas street through the rounded arch, turn left and enter the first glass doors to your left. Keep straight past the stairs and turn left into an open space with a reception desk along the left. The gender neutral toilet stall is also on the left between the reception desk and the elevator. Ahead is a open doorway to the NCAD Gallery space which has a glass wall facing Thomas Street traffic.
comment:
NCAD is open:
8am-9pm term time.
9am-5pm holiday/summer time.
Closed at weekends.
(If blue doors are completely shut at archway, it's closed).

It is inside the college grounds, but by the public gallery space. I went to college there for 4 years and was never once asked for my student card, still frequent there and they have a public cafe, etc. The age range of the college is vast, with tonnes of mature students up to and exceeding 60 yrs old. Do not be afraid, just act like you are supposed to be there or visiting a friend.

It is a single non gendered stall, fitted out for disabled access but not specifically for disabled only.

name: Erikslund Shopping Center
directions: On the 1st and 2nd floor of the shopping center. Placed in the middle of each floor. Right next to the elevators.Avoid IKEA\\'s gendered bathrooms at all costs. They\\'re situated on the 1st floor. Avoid. Avoid. Trust me. It\\'s worth the extra walk. Even when you\\'re just dying to use a bathroom.
comment: Open from 10am to 8pm everyday.There are separate stalls with floor to ceiling walls - in fact more like separate bathrooms. Each stall has a easy to use lock. Good lighting and BIG mirrors.It\\'s always well kept w. soap and paper and clean floors and stalls. AND there\\'s a room for changing diapers as well. Outside on BOTH floors there\\'s lockers, big enough to put your coat and shopping bags. You need a 5 kr coin to use them. BUT you get them back when you get your things.

name: Germany
comment:
When being in Berlin, you can ride the usual trains by Deutsche Bahn with a usual metro/tram/bus ticket AS LONG AS you're in the area you paid for ( Zone A+B, A+B+C, etc). So if you don't know another toilet, and you have a ticket, and maybe you have to go somewhere anywhere, check out if a train is going that direction instead of taking the subway/bus/train. There are toilets in all trains. They are gender neutral. 
The trains are often unsafe for People of Colour, especcially Black people because we have racial profiling by the police in germany. Also the staff in the trains might be racist, so take care not to get close to someonewearing a uniform.

directions: Reach Mountjoy Square, which is 2 minutes walk from the central O'Connell Street.Once there find the street that borders the square on the north, Mountjoy Square North. Belvedere Court is a small backstreet that is parallel to it.Go down the street until you see a black door with 'Seomra Spraoi' in pink.
comment: Seomra Spraoi is open Monday-Friday 6pm-10pm. It is an activist social centre. While it has accessibility issues, all of its bathrooms are gender free. It is a free social space so no buying of anything is required!

name: Exchange Dublin
directions: The Exchange is easy to find from Parliament Street, a central road in Dublin City. From Dublin Castle at the end of Parliament St, cross the road, and take a left. The first road parallel to Parliament St on the west side is Exchange Street Upper. At the bottom of it, in the corner, is The Exchange Dublin
comment: The Exchange Dublin is a free, grassroots-run arts space in central Dublin. It's meant to be a non-commercial space for people to socialise and for arts and activist projects to be hosted. The place is open from 11am to 11pm every day. Its only bathroom is gender free, and one is not required to purchase anything to use it.

We (I'm the one who's delivering the vespas, you might see me tuesdays and thursdays around 10 and 12am and 2 and 4 pm. I'm nonbinary).

name: O'Brien Centre for Science: East Wing

1) On the UCD Belfield campus, make your way to the lake; the O'Brien Centre is one of the buildings around it
2) Enter the O'Brien Centre through the main doors facing towards the lake, then walk straight ahead until you see a very large spiral staircase in an open area
3) Go up one floor & you will immediately see a set of bathrooms just off the staircase, one of which is unisex & accessible
comment:
-->It is not in a swipe-carded area of the building, so anyone on campus can walk in & use it, even if the O'Brien Centre is not where you usually work/study
-->If the 1st-foor bathroom is occupied, there are two more unisex accessible bathrooms, on the 2nd & 3rd floors (both just off the same spiral staircase in the East Wing)

name: S-Market Sastamala
comment: Maksullinen välillä.

name: Club BASIS
comment: Club (so, only during parties, mostly have to pay entrance). Gender neutral toilets, 5 stalls on one side, 3 urinals on the other side.

name: UCC Students' Union Common Room
comment: Better look like a student, I guess

name: Fyrens library
directions: There are restrooms both up and downstairs. The ones downstairs are in between the library and cafe. The ones upstairs are sometimes blocked off but are up the stairs/elevator and away from the seating area.
comment: There is one wheelchair accessible restroom downstairs and that’s also where the changing table is. The library puts out lgbt book recommendations in the entry way occasionally year round and i feel pretty safe there as a trans masculine person.

name: Mohill Computer Training
directions: Either go up first stairs and through classroom to side hallway, 3 single bathrooms. OR go through to the canteen in the middle hallway past the 2 offices, through canteen, up stairs, turn right to side hallway to the same bathrooms. ORRR... Stay on ground floor, straight to end of hall with water cooler, turn left to 2 single stalls.
comment: Don't know if they let just anyone come in without letting reception know first... Anyone who studies or works here freely goes to whatever single stall nearest.

name: Helios Klinikum Gifhorn
directions: The gender neutral accessible stall is by the main entrance. Non-accessible gendered single stalls are in the ER.

name: Streckerpark
directions: On Rohrbacherstraße side of park
comment: Free public toilet, two all-gender stalls, one of which is accessible

name: 1 bathroom in the whole of germany, tf, just leave funny messages my ppl, UwU Acidental was here
directions: Kinky and naked with a battle axe threw the door
comment: Weed Smokers only

name: Via Enrico Berlinguer, 5, 00053 Civitavecchia RM, Italy
Shannon Springs Hotel
directions: In the bar

name: DWH/Outsite
comment: Queer club with many trans staff, all toilets are ungendered. There is a ramp for wheelchair entry at the front door but you may have to ask someone to get it

name: Eethuis Today
directions: In the back down the stairs
comment: You have to be a paying customer

name: Bunsen
directions: Upstairs at the back
comment: Have to be eating in Bunsen but it’s a really nice place

name: Edeka Eisbrenner
directions: By the bakery

name: Bar Bizitza
directions: Planta baja, al fondo a la derecha

name: Müller
directions: First floor (1. Stock)

name: Dalton
directions: On the 5th floor. Accessible by elevator
comment: Building used partially/mainly for students of university of Utrecht, but you don't have to be one to use the bathroom (no checks as far as I know)

name: Iserhatsche
comment: Paying guests only

name: Public restroom
comment: You have to pay 0,50€ to use it

name: Reuvens building (Leiden University)
directions: There are about 4 entrances from the courtyard, so make sure you enter at Reuvensplaats 3 specifically. Once you've entered, there is an all-gender, wheelchair accessible bathroom on your left hand.
comment:
[unsure about the changing table situation - haven't had a chance to check] 
This is a University Building. I am unsure whether any lectures/workgroups are given here, but if there are, I think the groups may be a bit on the smaller side. I would not recommend saying you're here for a student-for-a-day day if you don't have a student ID. If someone you don't know approaches you, you could probably say you're supposed to meet a friend/sibling/kid/... there instead, but I don't think people will ask unless you look really lost.

name: Brogans Bar and Guesthouse
directions:
One under the stairs no changing table
Other is disabled bathroom with changing table where other bathrooms are.
comment: "paying customer"

name: Backlunds
comment: Gender neutral toilets. Meant for café customers

name: Freys Hotel
directions: Ask at the reception for directions.
comment: You have to ask for the access code at the reception. This is a toilet for guests of the hotel, but the hotel is very lgbt-friendly, so if you say you have to use the unisex restroom it should be fine.
